smell_analysis.justification: All provided diagrams contain elements and content; no empty diagrams were found.

All use cases are associated with actors either directly (e.g., 'Registreeri auto' to 'Autode haldur') or via include relationships initiated by actors (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel...' is included by 'Aktiveeri auto', which is connected to 'Autode haldur').
No actors are associated with multiple use cases sharing the same name. All use case names are unique per actor.
No packages contain multiple model elements with the same name.

No clear redundant data storage was found between tables without foreign keys. While generic columns like 'nimetus' appear in multiple tables (e.g., 'Auto_kategooria' and 'Auto_mark'), they represent different entities linked by Foreign Keys, which is standard normalization.
Use case naming is consistent, using the 'Verb + Noun' form in Estonian (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Tuvasta kasutaja').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', etc.) are reachable via transitions starting from the initial node.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions and decisions are reachable within the defined flow.
All relationships in class and database diagrams exhibit multiplicity indicators at both ends (e.g., '1' to '0..*').
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a specific diagram. The maximum observed was 5 connections for the 'Isik' class on Page 6.
The spatial layout of elements is reasonably balanced, with no related elements separated by excessive distances relative to the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No element names were found to be 3 characters or less. Shortest class/table names are 4 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto').
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto').
All attributes and columns start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_number').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto').
No prohibited Hungarian notation or type prefixes were found in names. Allowed prefixes (PK, FK) were used correctly. 'on_aktiivne' uses 'on' as the Estonian verb 'is', not a type prefix.
